lead_paragraph: The hour of decision came last week for Italy. In one of the great, climactic moments of the war Benito Mussolini fell from power and the iron bands of Fascist dictatorship were broken. The nation, under a new government headed by the 72-year-old soldier, Marshal Pietro Badoglio, was free to elect her course into the future.
